name: TheAtlantic
text: To shield slavery from the growing force of abolitionism, the most powerful people in the antebellum South circulated racist conspiracy theories. Their lies led the country to war—and still haunt American politics today, Annika Neklason writes. https://t.co/gQPcDTO0Gq

name: TheAtlantic
text: The running joke throughout Greg Daniels’s new Netflix comedy, “Space Force,” is the inanity of American power. That’s hard to laugh at in this particular moment, @sophieGG writes: https://t.co/l2pcDOXjZm

name: TheAtlantic
text: The point of the executive order is to stoke the flames of a culture war, and distract from Trump’s catastrophic mishandling of the COVID-19 pandemic and his dismantling of democracy, @ma_franks writes. https://t.co/MmvIQr8E0z

name: TheAtlantic
text: The president’s two strongest instincts stand pitted against each other: his need for attention and his need to punish enemies, Andrew Ferguson writes. https://t.co/1h1KTT4CqN
